News.Title: Nupur Recyclers Reports Improved Q3 EBITDA and Margin
News.Summary: Nupur Recyclers has announced its Q3 financial results, showing significant year-over-year improvements. The company's EBITDA increased to 29.2 million rupees from 17.9 million rupees in the same quarter last year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin expanded to 8.52% from 2.40% year-over-year, indicating enhanced operational efficiency.

News.Title: Nupur Recyclers Reports Significant Revenue Decline in Q3
News.Summary: Nupur Recyclers has reported a substantial decrease in revenue for the third quarter. The company's revenue stood at 343 million rupees, compared to 746 million rupees in the same period last year, representing a year-over-year decline.

News.Title: Nupur Recyclers Reports Significant Increase in Q3 Consolidated Net Profit
News.Summary: Nupur Recyclers has announced its Q3 consolidated net profit, which stands at 31.6 million rupees. This represents a substantial year-over-year increase from 9 million rupees in the same quarter last year. Additionally, the company has shown a quarter-over-quarter improvement, with profits rising from 47.6 million rupees in the previous quarter.

News.Title: Nupur Recyclers: Expansion into Lithium-ion Battery Recycling by 2027
News.Summary: Nupur Recyclers Limited (NRL) announced plans to expand into metal scrap processing and lithium-ion battery recycling, with a new facility set to open by 2027. The move aims to capitalize on growing demand in the electric vehicle sector. NRL's stock was trading at ₹109.70, down 0.63% on the NSE.

News.Title: Nupur Recyclers: ₹180 Million Investment in Aluminium Extrusion Subsidiary
News.Summary: Nupur Recyclers Limited invests ₹180 million in its subsidiary, Nupur Extrusion Private Limited, to enter aluminium extrusion manufacturing. The new facility in Haryana aims for 5,000-6,000 tons production capacity by FY 2025-26, targeting solar energy and construction sectors.

News.Title: Nupur Recycler: ₹13 Crore Investment Boosts Subsidiary's Capacity
News.Summary: Nupur Recycler Ltd (NRL) invests ₹13 crore in its subsidiary Frank Metals, aiming to increase production capacity from 1,500-2,000 to 5,000-6,000 tons annually. This follows a previous ₹27.97 crore investment in March 2024. NRL plans to expand product offerings and strengthen its position in metal recycling. The company's stock rose 2.38% on NSE following the announcement.
